comment: Scott Widmier made an already challenging capstone course unnecessarily difficult. He refuses to use D2L, never updates the calendar, and only communicates through Slack. His tone is often condescending, making it uncomfortable to ask questions. If you do, his go-to response is "watch the videos" instead of offering real help. Would not recommend.

Terrible communicator, unless talking about his boats! Makes students use Slack for communication as if we are working at a Tech start up. Is very unclear when answering questions, and is honestly upset when you don't instantly understand his lectures. Don't take him online even if you plan on using Slack a lot.

Would not recommend him. He can be very degrading and difficult to communicate with. The stimulation used in the class is also very difficult to understand and he is very rude if you do not immediately understand it. Not the harshest grader but would recommend taking someone else.

I am in my final semester, and he was the last professor open for marketing strategy. I see why all of his reviews are what they say because ITS TRUE! he sucks at teaching and is even worse at being rude towards students who are completely confused at a brand new program that has so many different features.

Professor Widmier just is not worth taking. If you get stuck with him it is not the end of the world, but he is arrogant and a little rude, which I do not think he means to be, but the curriculum is pretty easy until the final market simulation. 2/5

Not only does he not really teach much, the class is based mostly on a group project from a stimulation app that makes barely any sense. He barely has any lectures on actually how to use the stimulation and grades very harshly despite not actually teaching a thing the entire semester. I do not recommend unless he is the only option.

DO NOT TAKE 

Professor Widmier is extremely blunt/rude to students and his work does not correlate what so ever with what you will actually be doing in Marketing. You use a pointless simulation app during the semester and he even had faculty members on other teams for students when this was for a grade. 

Not hard but he makes it hard.
He wants you to use slack for communication, which is the dumbest thing I have ever used. He gets pissed off at any question you ask him and has no respect for students.
this guy is pretty based
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: If you are worried about getting your feelings hurt then don't take this professor. But if you aren't a snowflake and can take some criticism then take this guy. He is an incredible professor who really cares about your performance. The class is hard but what do you expect? It's marketing strategy. It isn't supposed to be easy. Recommend for sure.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: This guy is so unbelievably rude. He has no tests, just these absurdly long "case" assignments that he grades with a fine tooth comb and with a horrible attitude. He was actually quoted once as saying, "your knowledge or lack thereof" in his grading commentary, basically calling me stupid. When I am the furthest thing from it. I have a 3.8 GPA.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: 3 total group projects, 3 discussion grades, 3 individual assignments, 10 quizzes, no tests. Takes forever to return grades!!! Don't put off the projects until the last minute, they are very detailed and he grades individual work harder than group work.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: RECOMMEND. 1st half of class is lecture - quizzes no tests, easy. Second half of class is working on group projects and 4 case studies. Make sure to get a good group and pay attention. Grades case studies tough. Turn in work on time and ask questions when confused and you should get an A.

Great teacher and loves the subject matter; a little unclear with online students, possibly just due to the majority of the work being done in groups. Many discussions and many group projects. Ten online quizzes, but no tests. Helpful and does respond to emails.

Dr. Widmier was very enthusiastic & knowledgeable about teaching the class. Motivated students to learn with his positive attitude. Showed up to class each day with a smile on his face & plenty of jokes to tell throughout the semester. Great guy! You will actually LEARN from him. Pick good groups, go to class, pay attention & turn work in on timeA

He's the first MKTG professor I've had who has been able to really bridge the gap between textbook principlestheory with real life. The things he teaches are really relevant and helpful. Attending class was fun!

He's unclear on expectations, grades cases differently each times, posts grades late, grades term paper ridiculously harder than anything else in the class, and has an obnoxious, arrogant personality. His opinions are always fact in his mind and that's how your cases are graded. Though, I did learn from the discussions, grades don't reflect that.
I really enjoyed his class. If you are into sales, he has a lot of knowledge and very willing to help. He encouraged me to pursue a sales career.
Fairly easy class.  The only problem I have with this professor is that he is VERY unorganized and is slow at posting grades.  Unsure of where I stood in the class throughout the semester.

I went on the Trinidad study abroad trip with Dr. Widmier. Dr. Widmier did a fantastic job planning this trip, I have never done some much in 10 days.. gained valuable experience and had tons of fun! He's also a fun guy to hangout w/ and talk to.

no exams... only a 10 question multiple choice/TF quiz over each chapter (the day you review it, after he lectures/reads the power points)...very nice guy... not difficult at all... did have to do a Markstrat simulation (hated it...worst part)... overall a good, decently easy class... RECOMMENDED

Dr. Widmier and his prof selling course are great! He realizes that textbooks and tests aren't the best methods of teaching. Weekly quizzes were given over only 1 chapter, and exercises helped us apply what we read about. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!
